intro: Schwartzkopffia lastii, commonly known as the lastii swamp millet, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the wetlands of South Africa, where it thrives in marshy and swampy environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that grow in dense clusters. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by stabilizing soil and providing food for various insect species. Due to its unique adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
